thread.title: Sir Alex Ferguson tells Manchester United to focus on winning Europa League instead of top four
thread.title_full: Sir Alex Ferguson tells Manchester United to focus on winning Europa League instead of top four

author: rforrester
title: Sir Alex Ferguson tells Manchester United to focus on winning Europa League instead of top four
text:
'We've never won it' Sir Alex Ferguson tells Manchester United to focus on winning Europa League instead of top four 
Former boss wants the Red Devils to create history by winning the competition for the first time By Richard Forrester 22nd March 2017, 1:54 pm Updated: 22nd March 2017, 11:20 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments SIR ALEX FERGUSON believes Manchester United should focus on qualifying for the Champions League by being crowned Europa League champions. 
Jose Mourinho’s side will face Anderlecht in the last eight of the draw whilst also locked in a fierce battle with Tottenham, Arsenal, Liverpool and Manchester City for a top four spot. Getty Images 3 Manchester United legend Sir Alex Ferguson thinks the Red Devils should concentrate on winning the Europa League 
With Chelsea all-but confirming their place in the Champions League next season and the final three spots set to go down to the wire, Ferguson believes Mourinho should make history by going on to win the Europa League. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester United news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
United’s most successful ever manager told ESPN : “The thing is, we’ve never won the Europa League. 
“We’ve never won the UEFA Cup, what it used to be. And we’ve got a great draw. I’m not saying it’s a certainty, but they’ve got a great chance. 
“It gets you into the Champions League, too – it didn’t used to but it does now, and so that’s a great incentive. And there’s no Sevilla in it so that’s good. 
“And your CV gets bigger. If we won the Europa League? Fantastic. AP:Associated Press Manchester United face Anderlecht in the last eight of the Europa League related articles 4,000 empty seats Sadio Mane and Alex Iwobi are set to face each other in London but only 2,000 tickets have been sold THE BIG KICK OFF What TV channel is Uruguay vs Brazil on, what time is kick-off and what is the team news? going in for the kyl Manchester United bid £80million for Kylian Mbappe but Monaco refuse to sell teen sensation he's got some balls England fan strips completely naked and dances in stand during friendly with Germany in Dortmund RAM IT DOWN HIS THROAT Chris Gunter hits back at vicious attacks on his Wales team-mate Aaron Ramsey from Arsenal fans SAME AULD STORY Scotland 1 Canada 1: Gordon Strachan's side held as Steven Naismith cancels out Fraser Aird strike For pod's sake Lukas Podolski screamer KO's wasteful England as Germany legend signs out in style luk of the germans Germany 1 England 0: Lukas Podolski's stunning strike in his celebration game defeats Lions in Dortmund BIG HART Joe Hart shows incredible sportsmanship as he fist bumps Lukas Podolski after German scores screamer hugo boost for spurs Hugo Lloris tells Spurs he wants to stay at the club as long as Mauricio Pochettino does DOUBLE TROUBLE Arsene Wenger shelves contract talks with Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil until the summer preview What TV channel is Italy vs Albania on, what time is kick-off and what is the latest team news? Michael Carrick talks about Sir Alex Ferguson and his time at Man Utd PA:Press Association 3 Manchester United are in a fierce race to secure a top four spot 
"Add it to the European Cup, the Cup Winners' Cup, the Champions League. It's bigger and bigger. We also want to be the most successful club in England." 
If Arsenal can win their game in hand, just six points will separate second place Tottenham and Arsene Wenger's side. 
United are currently fifth, four points off Liverpool with two games in hand. Middlesbrough 1-3 Manchester United : United go above Arsenal in title race
